panels.description: Events are objects published and broadcasted to be picked up by all consumers that are listening to that event type. It means that something has happened. (e.g.: UserUpdated)
panels.title: Messages Published (Events)

panels.description: Commands are objects sent direct to an endpoint and will be picked up by the first consumer that implements it. It means that something must be performed after receiving that message.
panels.title: Messages Sent (Commands)

panels.description: Total number of messages consumed (one to many events)
panels.title: Publish Total

panels.description: Total number of message publish faults
panels.title: Publish Fault Total

panels.description: Total number of messages sent (one to one commands)
panels.title: Send Total

panels.description: Total number of message send faults
panels.title: Send Fault Total

panels.description: Total number of message consume faults
panels.title: Consume Fault Total

panels.description: Total number of message consume retries
panels.title: Consume Retry Total

panels.description: Elapsed time spent consuming a message, in seconds.
panels.title: Consume Duration (Seconds)

panels.description: Elapsed time between when the message was sent and when it was consumed, in seconds.
panels.title: Delivery Duration (Seconds)

title: MassTransit - Messages Monitoring
description:
MassTransit is a message-based distributed application framework for .NET http://masstransit-project.com.

MassTransit supports Prometheus metric capture, which provides useful observability into the bus, endpoints, consumers, and messages.

This dashboard shows the messages published and sent using MassTransit framework.
